name: Australia
notes: Federal

name: United Kingdom
notes: Great Britain + Northern Ireland

name: European Union
notes: Applies to providers in EU under DSA

name: Canada
notes: Federal + provinces; age assurance proposals currently focus on explicit content; online harms proposals evolving.

name: Ireland
notes: Online Safety Code applies to video-sharing platform services; age verification/parental controls.

name: France
notes: Digital majority concept at 15; implementation complexities.

name: Germany
notes: Youth media protection regime (JMStV) + DSA enforcement; age assurance relevant esp. for harmful content.

name: Brazil
notes: Digital ECA (Law No. 15,211/2025) framework for minors online; includes age verification and app download consent provisions.

name: India
notes: DPDP Act 2023 includes verifiable parental consent for processing children's data (<18); intermediary rules include access control mechanisms.

name: South Korea
notes: Policy discussions on teen social media curbs; strong existing identity/age assurance infrastructure context.

name: Japan
notes: No single national social-media minimum-age law identified; relies on sectoral rules, platform measures, and child safety policy debate.

name: Singapore
notes: IMDA Online Safety Code of Practice for App Distribution Services includes age assurance from Mar 31, 2025.

name: Indonesia
notes: Emerging child protection regulations for digital platforms; proposed/announced restrictions on youth accounts with parental consent concepts.

name: Malaysia
notes: Announced policy to ban social media accounts under 16 starting 2026 (per reporting).

name: Norway
notes: Government moving toward age limit 15 for social media (consultation proposal announced). Not yet enacted as of Dec 2025.

name: Denmark
notes: Political agreement announced for minimum age 15; legislation expected mid-2026 (not yet enacted).

name: Netherlands
notes: No specific social media minimum-age law identified; GDPR consent age is 16 (national choice).

name: Spain
notes: Draft organic law on protecting minors in digital environments (sent to Parliament) would raise consent age and add registration restrictions; status pending.

name: Italy
notes: GDPR consent age commonly treated as 14; proposals to raise discussed. No nationwide 'social media minimum age' ban identified.

name: United Arab Emirates
notes: No specific social media minimum-age law identified; PDPL lacks child-specific consent provisions per major law firm analysis.

name: Saudi Arabia
notes: No specific social media minimum-age law identified; PDPL/regs address guardian consent for those lacking legal capacity; children policy exists.
